name: reacquainted
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
familiar with something or someone again: Getting reacquainted with her father has been a slow process. He took a train trip across Russia to become reacquainted with his native land. See
reacquaint
More examplesFewer examplesThe band members got reacquainted recently at our LA studios."I've been reacquainted with people from my old life here," he said.He had not had any contact with her for ten years when the pair became reacquainted.
